title: RS tem previs√£o de chuvas intensas at√© domingo; Vale do Taquari registra queda de granizo | Rio Grande do Sul | G1
text:
RS tem previs√£o de chuva no final de semana
O Rio Grande do Sul tem previs√£o de chuvas intensas entre esta sexta-feira (13) e o domingo (15). No Vale do Taquari, a tarde desta sexta j√° foi de temporal em algumas localidades. Segundo a Sala de Situa√ß√£o do governo do estado, o Litoral Sul tem possibilidade de ventos de at√© 90 km/h .
üì≤ Acesse o canal do g1 RS no WhatsApp
De acordo com a Climatempo, a chuva √© provocada pela forma√ß√£o de uma √°rea de baixa press√£o sobre a Argentina e o oeste do RS, combinada com um forte fluxo de umidade vindo do Norte do Brasil e ventos intensos em altos n√≠veis da atmosfera.
O Vale do Taquari j√° registrou os primeiros impactos da chuva durante a tarde. Em Marques de Souza , caiu granizo em um temporal que durou 15 minutos . A medi√ß√£o da Emater da cidade aponta que choveu 60 mil√≠metros nesta tarde.
Uma passadeira provis√≥ria erguida entre Marques de Souza e Travesseiro foi danificada pelo temporal. A estrutura original havia sido levada pela enchente de maio deste ano. N√£o h√° registro de feridos.
Cidade afetada pela enchente ganha sistema de alerta para desastres
1 de 2 Ponte danificada e temporal de granizo em Marques de Souza ‚Äî Foto: Prefeitura de Marques de Souza/Divulga√ß√£o Ponte danificada e temporal de granizo em Marques de Souza ‚Äî Foto: Prefeitura de Marques de Souza/Divulga√ß√£o
Previs√£o para o fim de semana
No s√°bado (14) , a instabilidade avan√ßa em dire√ß√£o ao leste do estado. Partes da Serra, da Regi√£o Metropolitana e dos litorais Norte e Sul t√™m alerta para chuva. Os acumulados ficam entre 70 e 120 mil√≠metros na Regi√£o Sul , com ventos de at√© 90 km/h . Os term√¥metros devem marcar entre 17¬∞C e 29¬∞C. As regi√µes de Pelotas e Rio Grande est√£o na √°rea de chuva severa.
J√° no domingo , a Sala de Situa√ß√£o do estado projeta chuva na faixa leste, mas com menor intensidade. Nessas regi√µes, os acumulados ficam entre 30 e 70 mil√≠metros . Os ventos tamb√©m podem chegar a 90 km/h , com temperaturas entre 16¬∞C e 28¬∞C.
2 de 2 Previs√£o de chuva na sexta-feira (13), no s√°bado (14) e no domingo (15) no RS ‚Äî Foto: Sala de Situa√ß√£o RS/Divulga√ß√£o Previs√£o de chuva na sexta-feira (13), no s√°bado (14) e no domingo (15) no RS ‚Äî Foto: Sala de Situa√ß√£o RS/Divulga√ß√£o
V√çDEOS: Tudo sobre o RS

author: Newsfile
title: Startup Fortune: Leading AI Platform DeepFakeAI Surprises Community Holders with New Pricing Tiers to Amplify Token Utility
text:
Singapore, Singapore--(Newsfile Corp. - December 28, 2023) - In a time when AI technology is advancing rapidly at the forefront of innovation, the popular blockchain platform DeepFakeAI is making it even easier for its users to leverage the new technology. The team continues to push boundaries, setting a remarkable precedent for innovation within the crypto and blockchain space. The introduction of new pricing tiers serves as a testament to the team's commitment to user accessibility, token utility, and continuous technological advancement.
A Unique approach to content creation: DeepFakeAI's uniqueness lies not only in its utilization of advanced algorithms but also in its dedication to user experience. The platform empowers users to effortlessly create intricate and lifelike videos, blurring the lines between reality and imagination. Whether for crafting promotional materials, instructional content, or entertainment videos, DeepFakeAI offers a versatile tool that resonates across various domains.
More utility to the token: In a move that resonates with its community, DeepFakeAI is bringing new pricing tiers, delivering one of the most requested features. This development significantly enhances the utility of the platform's native token, $FakeAI, making the technology accessible to a broader audience.
Starting now, holders with fewer than 1,000,000 tokens can seamlessly leverage the power of AI, democratizing access and opening the door for a more inclusive creative community. This strategic move aligns with the project's ethos of encouraging widespread participation and engagement, irrespective of token holdings. These newly introduced tiers allow users to choose the plan that best aligns with their needs and aspirations for AI-generated content.
The team hints at exciting developments slated for 2024, including the introduction of DIY characters and enhanced lip sync capabilities for AI-generated videos. These upcoming features promise to elevate the user experience, offering even more creative avenues for users to explore. DeepFakeAI continues to redefine the landscape of decentralized AI applications with its blend of innovation and accessibility.
For media inquiries and more information, please contact:
Alex Jonas, info@fakeai.io
Website: https://fakeai.io
Twitter: https://twitter.com/DeepFakeAI_
To view the source version of this press release, please visit https://www.newsfilecorp.com/release/192669
SOURCE: Startup Fortune

author: Brieanna Charlebois, The Canadian Press
title: B.C. civil lawsuit against Sex Pistols guitarist alleges 1980 sexual assault ‚Äì Brandon Sun
text: Advertisement Read this article for free: or Already have an account? Log in here ¬ª We need your support! Local journalism needs your support! As we navigate through unprecedented times, our journalists are working harder than ever to bring you the latest local updates to keep you safe and informed. Now, more than ever, we need your support. Starting at $14.99 plus taxes every four weeks you can access your Brandon Sun online and full access to all content as it appears on our website. [Subscribe Now](/subscribe) or call circulation directly at (204) 727-0527. Your pledge helps to ensure we provide the news that matters most to your community! Read unlimited articles for free today: or Already have an account? Log in here ¬ª VANCOUVER ‚Äì A Vancouver woman has filed a civil lawsuit against Paramount Pictures Corp. and punk rocker Stephen Jones of The Sex Pistols alleging he sexually assaulted her as a teenager while she was a movie extra more than 40 years ago. A B.C. Supreme Court statement of claim filed by the plaintiff says she was 14 years old and working on the movie ‚ÄúLadies & Gentlemen, The Fabulous Stains‚Äù when Jones supplied her with marijuana, then sexually assaulted her in his hotel room. The court has placed a publication ban on the woman‚Äôs name. Her lawyer Jason Gratl said in an interview that he could not comment about why the lawsuit was brought 44 years after the alleged events. ‚ÄúI only wanted to say one thing and it‚Äôs that she kept a diary,‚Äù Gratl said. The notice of claim filed Wednesday says Paramount didn‚Äôt take adequate steps to warn minors or their parents about the risks of working on the set with Jonesor impose contractual terms restricting his contact with young extras or using illicit drugs. None of the allegations have been tested in court. Paramount did not immediately return a request for comment. Jones could not be reached for comment. Neither Paramount, nor Jones have filed a statement of defence. The lawsuit says Paramount hired Jones, who was 24 at the time, for a role in the film because of his reputation as a ‚Äúpunk rocker‚Äù who consumed excessive amounts of drugs and alcohol, and engaged in sexual misconduct, including with underage girls. ‚ÄúThe defendant Paramount was banking on the defendant Jones‚Äô reputation and history to market ‚ÄòThe Fabulous Stains,'‚Äù the statement says, adding the company ‚Äúalso hired other well-known punk rock musicians as actors for the same purpose.‚Äù The statement says that despite this knowledge, the company did not take steps to protect young workers. The movie, about disaffected teens in a punk rock band, was released in 1982. The legal action says the woman is seeking damages, claiming the alleged assault ‚Äúcaused her to suffer psychological injury, including loss of self-esteem, loss of self-worth, injurious self-imaging and identity, and loss of trust in intimacy and potential partners.‚Äù The lawsuit says she was hired as one of the hundreds of extras playing fans for the all-girl feminist rock band. Jones had been hired to play the role of a ‚Äúsocially volatile punk rock guitar player in a fictitious all-male band, The Looters.‚Äù It says that on April 13, 1980, the teen went to the Denman Inn, ‚Äúa location under the direction and control‚Äù of Paramount, with the intention of inviting the movie‚Äôs lead actor, Diane Lane, to go roller skating. When she entered the lobby, it says Jones approached her, told her he had Lane‚Äôs number in his hotel room and asked her to go with him to get it. Once they were inside his room, it says Jones gave her marijuana, and he then turned off the lights and closed the curtains. The document says she understood that meant he was likely to make sexual advances, she told Jones she did not consent and was ‚Äúonly 14, 1-4.‚Äù It says despite this, he pulled her onto his bed, climbed on top of her then kissed and molested her. ‚ÄúThe plaintiff repeatedly and expressly told the defendant Jones ‚Äòno‚Äô and tried to move his hand away, and finally wriggled free from him and left the room,‚Äù the notice of claim says. The lawsuit says she was initially ‚Äúboth repulsed and flattered by this unwanted sexual attention from someone she believed to be a rock star and movie star.‚Äù Because she was confused by what had happened, the document says she did not tell her parents and it wasn‚Äôt until she was older that she ‚Äúfelt sexually violated and sexually ashamed and angry‚Äù about the alleged assault. This report by The Canadian Press was first published April 25, 2024.

author: Paigambar Mohan Raj
title: Solana-Based BONK Overtakes Shiba Inu & Dogecoin Volumes
text: BONK, a memecoin based on the Solana (SOL) network, has seen a significant price rise since November. The memecoin‚Äôs price remained stagnant for most of 2023 but has skyrocketed over the last month. [Also Read: Here is How To Be a Millionaire When BONK Hits $0.01](https://watcher.guru/news/heres-how-to-be-a-millionaire-when-bonk-hits-0-01) BONK‚Äôs recent rally follows a listing on Coinbase, one of the most significant crypto exchanges. Moreover, the Solana-based token‚Äôs trade volume has surpassed rivals such as Dogecoin (DOGE) and Shiba Inu (SHIB) on Coinbase, exceeding the $30 million mark. Will the Solana-based memecoin surge further? Since January, BONK‚Äôs price has surged by over 6700%, making it one of the best-performing cryptocurrencies in 2023. The token has outperformed the likes of Solana (SOL), which has surged nearly 1000%, and Bitcoin (BTC), which has risen by about 160% in the same time frame. However, despite the recent price spike, the Solana-based token has faced a massive correction, falling by over 14% in the daily charts, over 40% in the weekly charts, and over 12% in the last 14 days. Nonetheless, the memecoin is still up 244.5% over the previous month. [Also Read: Solana-Based BONK Plunges 40%, Can Santa Fest Spark a Revival?](https://watcher.guru/news/solanas-bonk-plunges-40-in-3-days-can-santa-fest-spark-a-revival) BONK might continue to falter, given that the token does not have a lot of utility. Moreover, Dogecoin (DOGE) and Shiba Inu (SHIB) dominate the memecoin space, whose performance in 2023 has also been lackluster. According to CoinCodex, the Solana-based memecoin‚Äôs price may consolidate around current levels. The platform anticipates BONK to reach $0.00001487 on Jan.1, 2024. BONK‚Äôs recent correction seems to mimic Solana‚Äôs (SOL) trajectory. SOL recently hit a yearly high, but the asset‚Äôs price has since dropped. SOL is currently down by over 6% in the daily charts. BONK may see a rise in price if SOL picks up momentum. Moreover, the memecoin may rise again if we enter a bull run in 2024.

organizations.name: bonk overtakes shiba inu & dogecoin volumes bonk

author: Amarillo Globe-News - Unlimited Digital Access
title: Xcel Energy readies for cold weather, offers tips for customers
text: Xcel Energy, Southwest Power Pool prepared for high electricity demand during extreme cold Xcel Energy said Friday it is closely monitoring changing weather conditions that will bring extreme cold to the Texas-New Mexico region over the weekend through the first half of next week. "The company is working closely with the Southwest Power Pool to ensure the region‚Äôs power supply can meet the expected increase in electricity demand," a company release says. "Regional power generating resources have been inspected and winterized and all available generating units will be dispatched as needed. Xcel Energy is also monitoring the region‚Äôs transmission and distribution networks and is ready to respond to any contingency." The SPP has issued a Conservative Operations advisory to its member providers effective 4 a.m. Sunday, with an anticipated end of 9 p.m. Tuesday. This advisory does not require the public to conserve energy and is issued to raise awareness of potential threats to reliability among entities responsible for operating transmission and generation facilities. While there is always some degree of uncertainty related to weather prediction, both Xcel Energy and SPP anticipate the region will have enough power generation to serve the energy demand of the SPP footprint throughout the storm period, the utility said. Visit spp.org/grid-conditions for timely and regular updates regarding current advisories and grid conditions. Xcel Energy said in earlier January release that it was prepared for the first winter blast in Texas and New Mexico of the year, and the company reminded customers of ways they can stay warm, save money and stay informed in the event of a power outage. ‚ÄúThe reliability of our system is vital any time of year, but even more important during extreme cold,‚Äù said Adrian J. Rodriguez, president, Xcel Energy ‚Äì New Mexico, Texas in the release. ‚ÄúOur customers can be assured that we‚Äôve taken steps to winterize power plants and harden the grid. Our employees are highly trained and stand ready to manage our power plants and address issues with power lines quickly and safely in the event of an interruption to electric service.‚Äù As a reminder, the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) is often referred to as the ‚ÄúTexas power grid,‚Äù even though it does not cover the entire state. Texas is served by four separate power grids. ERCOT serves major population centers and the bulk of Texas; Midcontinent Independent System Operator reaches into southeast Texas; the Western Electricity Coordinating Council serves the southwest tip of Texas (El Paso area); and the Southwest Power Pool (SPP) serves Xcel Energy in the Texas South Plains and Panhandle. Xcel Energy‚Äôs New Mexico region is also served by SPP. The impending [extreme cold temperatures](/story/news/2024/01/11/ercot-issues-watch-as-arctic-blast-approaches-texas-high-plains/72193375007/) set to settle over the area prompted several agencies and businesses including [Atmos Energy](/story/news/2024/01/10/atmos-energy-offers-winter-weather-preparedness-safety-tips/72176467007/) to send out safety tips this week on how people can stay prepared in the event of inclement weather and possible outages. More: [Amarillo MLK celebration moves indoors due to extreme cold weather](/story/news/2024/01/12/2024-mlk-parade-celebration-moves-to-palo-duro-activity-center/72190090007/) Xcel Energy said in the earlier release from the company that it has "invested more than $3 billion in grid improvements over the past decade to strengthen the region‚Äôs electric system and boost power imports from neighboring states. Additionally, area power plants and wind farms were designed for cold weather and are continually being improved to withstand extreme temperatures. Winterization reviews are conducted annually each fall at Xcel Energy‚Äôs Texas-New Mexico power plants, and new wind farms, such as Sagamore in New Mexico and Hale in Texas, were built with 'cold weather packages' that allow the turbines to run in subzero temperatures." The company said it has replaced thousands of wooden poles and updated wire on many key distribution feeder lines across the area to reduce outages caused by high winds and ice buildup. And ongoing improvements at the neighborhood level are providing more options for Xcel Energy to reroute and restore power quicker in the event of weather-related outages. How customers can prepare for inclement weather Customers can be prepared for extreme temperatures by having their heating equipment checked ahead of cold weather and taking steps to make interior spaces more airtight by adding weather stripping around doors and windows. Customers can take advantage of Xcel Energy‚Äôs Home Energy Services program by having approved contractors inspect their property for drafts and make the necessary adjustments free of charge. Information on this program can be found online on the Energy Efficiency Services page at xcelenergy.com. Winter heating accounts for about half a typical customer‚Äôs monthly energy costs, so it‚Äôs possible to realize big savings in the winter if customers keep warm air from escaping to the outside and ensuring heating units don‚Äôt have to run as often, Xcel Energy said. Another important way to save on heating costs is to adjust the thermostat 7 to 10 degrees Fahrenheit from normal settings for eight hours a day. A programmable or smart thermostat can make these adjustments more convenient, allowing customers to schedule thermostat adjustments. Many new thermostats can also be controlled remotely via a mobile device, and the most advanced models can adjust settings automatically based on activity inside the home. Energy Star-certified smart thermostats can save up to 8% annually on heating and cooling costs, according to energystar.gov. How to report power outages Should extreme weather come with ice and damaging wind, customers can help Xcel Energy get a jumpon power restoration by reporting outages. Customers have a number of ways to report their outages: - Via the Xcel Energy mobile app available on iOS and Android - Online at xcelenergy.com/out - Call 1-800-895-1999 and follow the prompts ‚Äî the automated phone reporting system lets customers report outages in less than 60 seconds. Additionally, the website features an outage map that displays information on the number of customersout and anticipated time for restoration.

author: Hubert Leclercq Karin Tshidimba Constance Fr√®re Vincent Braun
title: RDC : L‚Äôalliance Fleuve Congo de Nangaa d√©fie ouvertement Tshisekedi
text:
Corneille Nangaa, le patron de la Commission √©lectorale nationale ind√©pendante (Ceni) lors de la pr√©sidentielle en 2018, devenu coordonnateur du mouvement politico-militaire de l‚ÄôAlliance Fleuve Congo (AFC) lance un appel √† la mobilisation du peupe congolais face √† ce qu‚Äôil pr√©sente comme ¬´ un hold-up √©lectoral ¬ª du pr√©sident sortant.
Deux semaines depuis l‚Äôannonce de la cr√©ation de ce mouvement √† Nairobi, capitale du Kenya qui en novembre 2018 avait vu na√Ætre la plateforme Cach de F√©lix Tshiskedi et Vital Kamerhe.
Deux semaines lors desquelles le peuple congolais a √©t√© appel√© √† se prononcer, lors des √©lections pr√©sidentielle et l√©gislatives, sur l‚Äôavenir politique du pays.
Corneille Nangaa √©voque dans ce texte ¬´ la com√©die de bricolage des chiffres, honteusement pr√©sent√©s comme r√©sultats partiels des scrutins √©lastiquement trafiqu√©s. Ces r√©sultats imaginaires ne refl√®tent ni la volont√© populaire ni la dynamique de la campagne √©lectorale au cours de laquelle d‚ÄôEst en Ouest en passant par le centre du pays, le peuple a fait savoir son d√©saveu √† l‚Äô√©gard de Monsieur Tshilombo, publiquement trait√© √† juste titre de voleur, de menteur, de corrompu, de tribaliste, de fain√©ant, etc. ¬ª Avant d‚Äôajouter : ¬´ Ce spectacle de fraude √† ciel ouvert enfonce davantage le pays dans une grave crise de l√©gitimit√©. ¬ª
Partant de ce postulat, le coordonnateur explique encore que l‚ÄôAFC r√©prouve le montage ayant abouti au simulacre d‚Äô√©lections du 20 d√©cembre 2023. ¬ª Monsieur Tshilombo appartient au pass√©. Son spectacle √©lectoral, ses r√©sultats imaginaires et toutes les institutions qui en d√©couleront n‚Äôengageront point le peuple congolais ¬ª.
Il annonce dans la foul√©e la d√©termination de son mouvement √† tout faire, conform√©ment, notamment, √† l‚Äôarticle 64 de la Constitution congolaise, pour ¬´ r√©tablir la normalit√© d√©mocratique et la l√©galit√© r√©publicaine ¬ª.
L‚ÄôAFC pr√©vient ensuite M. Tshhilombo qu‚Äôelle ¬´ ne reculera devant aucune manoeuvre, aucune attaque et encore moins aucune intimidation de sa part pour atteindre son objectif ultime, la conqu√™te du pouvoir √† Kinshasa pour restaurer la normalit√© d√©mocratique et mettre fin √† la crise de l√©gitimit√© dont il est personnellement l‚Äôauteur ¬ª.
Viennent ensuite des condamnations
- de la ¬´ r√©pression sanglante ¬ª contre ceux qui ont os√© marcher pacifiquement pour condamner ¬´ le coup d‚ÄôEtat √©lectoral en cours ¬ª,
- de l‚Äôhyper militarisation du Katanga par les forces arm√©es et la police congolaise. Des troupes qui seraient compos√©es essentiellement sur base tribale et viendraient en appui aux ¬´ milices criminelles ¬ª (Forces du progr√®s, FDLR)
- des tueries g√©n√©ralis√©es des populations congolaises innocentes par des bombardements aveugles et criminels, notamment Mushaki, Karuba, Kipolirwe et environs.
M. Nangaa √©voque encore les ¬´ crimes de guerre document√©s ¬ª et pr√©vient que les forces de l‚ÄôAFC se chargeront ¬´ de neutraliser l‚Äôennemi (‚Ä¶) et d‚Äôassurer la protection des citoyens ¬ª.
Il appelle ensuite toutes les forces vives du pays et de la diaspora √† se joindre √† son mouvement, avant de terminer par un ¬´ La patrie ou la mort ¬ª, citation emprunt√©e √† Ernesto Che Guevara.
M. Nangaa a-t-il les moyens de ses ambitions sur le terrain ? Lors du lancement de son mouvement, il avait annonc√© disposer du soutien de quelques mouvements arm√©s et, certains de ses proches ont annonc√© que depuis cette annonce, l‚ÄôAFC avait pu f√©d√©rer d‚Äôautres forces‚Ä¶

author: Chapin Jewell News & Tribune Correspondent
title: Felton‚Äôs 26 leads Keyser girls over Moorefield, 55-36
text:
MOOREFIELD, W.Va. (WV News) ‚Äì As the two teams entered the fourth and final period, the Keyser lead over Moorefield was slim, just six points, 33-27. In that final frame, however, Keyser‚Äôs Bibs Felton exploded for 10 of her game-high 26 points, and the Lady Tornado outscored Moorefield 22-9 to earn the 19-point, 55-36 victory.
Felton led Keyser with 26 points in total, with Autumn Kerchner also scoring in double figures with 11 points. Next was Rooney Urice with six points, Makalya Gillaspie and Kiya Kesner with four points each, Austyn Healy with two points, and Carlee Staggs and Kiara Kesner one point each.
In the loss, Moorefield was led by Cici. Kump and Amber Williams with seven and six points respectively. Next was Jaden Cullers with five points, Sadie Crites with four points, and McKenna Crites, Korbin Keplinger, LeAnne Coon, and Sydney Rumer with three points apiece. Rounding out the scoring was Raleigh Kuykendall with two points.
Keyser started fast, outscoring Moorefield 12-5 in the opening period to take a seven-point lead early. Autumn Kerchner led Keyser with seven of the Lady Tornado‚Äôs 11 points in the opener. Cici Kump and Korbin Keplinger led Moorefield in the frame with two points each.
In the second period, Keyser kept control, but only edged Moorefield by one point, 13-12. The result? An eight-point, 25-17 Keyser lead at the half. Bibs Felton led Keyser with eight points in the second stanza. Kump led Moorefield with five points.
After the third period, Moorefield again played Keyser tight, actually edging the Black and Gold 10-8 to cut the Lady Tornado‚Äôs lead to just six points, 33-27, heading into the fourth and final frame. Jaden Cullers scored five of Moorefield‚Äôs 10 points in the third. Felton scored six of Keyser‚Äôs eight points.
Then came the fourth quarter explosion with Felton scoring 10 points in the lid closer, and Keyser in general outscoring Moorefield 22-9 to blow things wide open in Keyser‚Äôs 19-point, 55-36 victory.
Keyser (4-2) next hosts Hedgesville on Friday, Dec. 29, at 7:30 p.m.

author: Nicole Silverio
title: ‚ÄòRadioactive Waste For Voters‚Äô: Kevin O‚ÄôLeary Says Kamala Harris ‚ÄòHas To Get Rid Of Biden‚Äô To Win Over Americans | The Daily Caller
text:
‚ÄúShark Tank‚Äù co-star Kevin O‚ÄôLeary said Vice President Kamala Harris has to distance herself from President Joe Biden in order for her economic policies to appeal to Americans.
Harris took the stage with President Joe Biden in Maryland on Thursday, where they touted the administration‚Äôs effort to allow Medicare to negotiate drug prices. O‚ÄôLeary said on Fox News‚Äô ‚ÄúThe Story with Martha MacCallum‚Äù that Harris must distance herself from Biden on the economy since polls have indicated his economic policies are unpopular.
‚ÄúWhat I was really listening for was if she was gonna center somewhere,‚Äù O‚ÄôLeary said. ‚ÄúBecause if the strategy is just bash big business, bash energy, bash Pharma, bash [US Aggregate Bond], bash everything, then she‚Äôs a leftist again, she can‚Äôt win the election. So my prediction is and we‚Äôll know more next week after the convention, she has to get rid of Biden. I understand the heritage thing and everything, but she‚Äôs gotta distance herself from Bidenomics, that is radioactive waste for voters. So if she doesn‚Äôt bring some daylight in and go to the center, she‚Äôll just lose.‚Äù
Kevin O‚ÄôLeary Says Kamala Harris ‚ÄòHas To Get Rid Of Biden‚Äô To Win Over Americans pic.twitter.com/hpoeT3wrz4
‚Äî Daily Caller (@DailyCaller) August 15, 2024
Harris is reportedly intending to distance herself from Biden‚Äôs economic policies dubbed ‚ÄúBidenomics,‚Äù which polls indicated has been a weak spot throughout his presidency, according to an Axios report on Wednesday. She is poised to announce her first major economic plan during a Friday rally in Raleigh, North Carolina, where she will reportedly propose a federal ban on supposed corporate ‚Äúprice-gouging‚Äù on food and groceries. (RELATED: Kamala Harris Tackling Joe‚Äôs Achilles Heel Open Up Even Bigger One For Herself)
Inflation has been a devastating political issue for Biden, as it rose from 1.4% when Biden took office in January 2021 to a peak of 9% in June 2022.The Consumer Price Index (CPI), which measures the price of everyday goods, fell below 3% in July for the first time in two years.
White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre denied that Harris intends to create a distance, saying on Wednesday that the vice president took part in passing the president‚Äôs economic agenda.
‚ÄúWhat I will tell you is Bidenomics has been something that both the president and the vice president has worked on,‚Äù Jean-Pierre said Wednesday. ‚ÄúYou guys have called it ‚ÄòBidenomics,‚Äô we talk about how the president is trying to put forward an economic policy building from the bottom-up, middle-out that does not leave behind the middle class and make sure it has equity at the center of it.‚Äù
Biden told Fox News White House correspondent Peter Doocy on Thursday that Harris does not intend to create daylight between herself and his economic policies.
A New York Times/Siena poll from Saturday found Republican nominee Donald Trump leading Harris on the economy 53% to 44% in Pennsylvania, Michigan and Wisconsin. A poll by The Financial Times found on Aug. 12 that Harris edged Trump by 1 point, 42% to 41%, on the economy, despite nearly half of the respondents expressing disapproval of Biden‚Äôs economic policies.
All content created by the Daily Caller News Foundation, an independent and nonpartisan newswire service, is available without charge to any legitimate news publisher that can provide a large audience. All republished articles must include our logo, our reporter‚Äôs byline and their DCNF affiliation. For any questions about our guidelines or partnering with us, please contact licensing@dailycallernewsfoundation.org .

author: Phil Norris
title: Flood threat grows with four warnings in place ahead of severe weather warning - Gloucestershire Live
text: There are now four red alert Flood Warnings in Gloucestershire after the Environment Agency raised the alarm ahead of more forecast heavy rain. The [weather](https://www.gloucestershirelive.co.uk/all-about/weather) warnings mean flooding is expected, act now, and are in place along the River Severn between Gloucester and Tewkesbury. The warnings come ahead of a [severe weather warning for wind](https://www.gloucestershirelive.co.uk/news/cheltenham-news/met-office-issues-severe-weather-9002993) that has been issued for Saturday and Sunday. Heavy rain is also forecast in the county while a weather warning for rain has been issued by the [Met Office](https://www.metoffice.gov.uk/) for Wales over the weekend, which could put extra pressure on Gloucestershire rivers in days to come. The four warning areas in Gloucestershire are for the Severn at Abbots Court, Deerhurst; Apperley and The Leigh; Chaceley and Haw Bridge; Severn Ham, Tewkesbury. Flood warnings are also in force on the River Wye from Hereford to Ross-on-Wye; North Hereford; and South Hereford. READ MORE: [Met Office issues severe weather warning for Gloucestershire as cold front heads to UK](https://www.gloucestershirelive.co.uk/news/cheltenham-news/met-office-issues-severe-weather-9002993) READ MORE: [Live flood warnings in Gloucestershire with UK snow risk amid 2024 cold snap forecast](https://www.gloucestershirelive.co.uk/news/cheltenham-news/live-flood-warnings-gloucestershire-uk-9002556) The [Environment Agency](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/environment-agency) said river levels are rising after heavy rainfall and flooding is expected to affect properties and roads. Flood defences are being checked by its staff. People are urged to avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. River peaks could be as late as Monday. Latest updates will be in our live blog.
